title: Stagiaire Analyste de données – Équipe logicielle
company_industry: Data Infrastructure and Analytics and Renewable Energy Equipment Manufacturing
description:
**EVLO** 
 est une filiale technologique d’Hydro-Québec menant des activités de recherche, de développement et de commercialisation des systèmes de stockage d’énergie.
 



 Gérée comme une entreprise indépendante, cette nouvelle filiale d’Hydro-Québec est à la fine pointe de la technologie et est formée d’une équipe dynamique d’ingénieurs et de techniciens qualifiés travaillant collectivement dans le but de rendre notre planète plus verte. L’expertise et les compétences de cette équipe multidisciplinaire sont mises à profit afin de répondre aux exigences en matière d’énergie renouvelable.
 



 Nous avons besoin de gens comme vous pour atteindre nos objectifs, afin de conquérir le domaine du stockage d’énergie.
 



 Nous vous invitons à prendre une minute pour découvrir le produit sur lequel vous serez appelé à travailler à l’aide de cette courte vidéo : https://youtu.be/dhSWzz8iXG0
 



  





***Vos défis***




  





 EVLO est une entreprise “green tech” spécialisant dans la conception et le développement de systèmes de stockage d’énergie par batteries (BESS). En tant que membre à part entière de notre équipe logicielle, tu contribueras directement au développement d’une suite logicielle utilisée pour contrôler, monitorer et opérer nos BESS. Notre équipe développe essentiellement le “cerveau” de nos produits de stockage à grande échelle, intégrés à des réseaux électriques et des centrales d’énergies renouvelables : le EMS (Energy Management System).
 



  





 En particulier, en tant que membre de l’équipe de données, tu contribueras aux batterie infrastructure de données tout en ayant l’occasion d’être impliqué dans les activités de reliées à notre infrastructure de données et à l’analyse de ces données. En te joignant à nous, tu travailleras dans un environnement collaboratif avec une équipe dynamique et enjouée. Tu combineras l’art du design avec la science de la programmation. L’entreprise étant actuellement en phase de développement et de commercialisation dans un domaine en rapide croissance, les opportunités ne manqueront pas d’avoir un impact important et rapide sur des développements d’envergure, et de faire rayonner cette technologie québécoise à l’international.
 



  





***Votre rôle et principales responsabilités***




  




* Effectuer une analyse approfondie des données afin d'identifier les tendances, les anomalies et les possibilités d'amélioration dans les données opérationnelles du SME.
* Collaborer avec des équipes inter fonctionnelles pour extraire des informations précieuses des données et formuler des recommandations.
* Participer à l'élaboration d'outils de visualisation des données et de rapports.
* Soutenir les efforts permanents de test des batteries et de collecte de données sur le terrain et dans les laboratoires.
* Contribuer à la rédaction de rapports destinés aux clients et visant à améliorer la santé des batteries.



  





  





***Profil recherché***




  





**Votre éducation et expérience** 



* Poursuivre une diplomation dans un domaine pertinent tel que le génie électrique, la science des matériaux ou la science des données, d’activités (Informatique, mathématiques, statistiques, etc.);
* Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
* Excellentes aptitudes à la communication et au travail en équipe.
* Enthousiasme pour les énergies renouvelables et la technologie des batteries.
* Développement d'applications utilisant des sources de données
* Bonne compréhension de l'anglais et du français
* Connaissance des systèmes électriques, un atout.



  





**Vos connaissances spécifiques** 



* Maîtrise des outils d'analyse de données tels que Python, R ou MATLAB.
* Familiarité avec les techniques et outils de visualisation de données tels que PowerBI et Grafana.
* Expérience des bases de données et des données avec des bases de données de séries chronologiques, SQL, Parquet.



  





  





**Vos compétences** 



* Orienté vers le travail d’équipe et la coopération
* Souci du détail et de la qualité
* Capacité dans les relations interpersonnelles
* Flexibilité et autonomie



  





***Ce qu’offre l’équipe EVLO***



* Opportunité de travailler sur des projets réels avec des professionnels expérimentés.
* Stage rémunéré selon les normes en vigueur.
* Opportunité de croissance et de prise d’initiative
* Équipement fourni facilitant le travail hybride
* Accessible en transport en commun
* Et oui…le café est offert aussi!



  





***Durée du stage***



* Période : 4 mois, 6 mois, 1 an
* 1804 Blvd Lionel Boulet, Varennes
* Automne 2024 / Hiver 2025



  





 Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers EVLO toutefois, prenez note que nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats sélectionnés. Le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte.

title: Web Developer Intern - (Co-op Position)
description:
**About Us**
 Total Life is a mental healthcare organization solely committed to serving older adults by taking an evidence-based approach to wellbeing and aging. Total Life is on a mission to support older adults and combat mental health issues by making quality, affordable emotional support services easily accessible through a telehealth platform. As a company, we are dedicated to making an impactful change in the world by prioritizing the mental health and wellbeing of this vulnerable demographic.
   

  

**Description:** 
 Join the dynamic marketing team at Total Life, an innovative online teletherapy company dedicated to supporting seniors' mental health and well-being. As a Content Creation and Marketing Intern, you will gain hands-on experience in creating impactful content, developing marketing strategies, and engaging with our target audience. This position is ideal for an outgoing and creative student passionate about mental health, digital marketing, and making a difference in the lives of seniors.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Web Design and Development: Assist with designing and reformatting outdated web pages on Totallife.com.
* Content Development: Assist in creating engaging and informative content for various platforms, including blog posts, social media updates, newsletters, and website pages.
* Creative Collaboration: Work closely with the creative team on brainstorming and developing new content ideas, ensuring alignment with current social trends and audience interests.
* Video and Audio Editing: Assist in recording, editing, and producing multimedia content such as videos, podcasts, and webinars.
* Graphic Design Support: Create visually appealing graphics for social media posts, email campaigns, and website content using tools like Canva or Adobe Creative Suite.
* SEO and Keyword Research: Conduct keyword research and implement SEO best practices to optimize content for search engines.
* Event Coordination: Assist in planning and executing virtual events, webinars, and live social media sessions.
* Additional Duties: Provide general support to the marketing team as needed, including administrative tasks and project coordination.


**Term Project**
 The primary goal of this project is to update and reformat outdated web pages on Totallife.com to align with our new design templates while integrating SEO best practices across all pages. The intern will gain hands-on experience in web development, content management, and search engine optimization, providing them with a comprehensive understanding of how web design and SEO work together to enhance user experience and online visibility.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Currently enrolled in a BCom Degree at a local university.
* Strong writing and editing skills with an eye for detail.
* Familiarity with social media platforms and digital marketing tools.
* Basic understanding of SEO principles and keyword research.
* Proficiency in graphic design and video editing software.
* Outgoing personality with a strong understanding of social trends and the ability to engage with diverse audiences.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Passionate about mental health and committed to supporting seniors.


**Benefits**
* Gain practical experience in a real-world marketing environment.
* Work with a supportive and experienced team.
* Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the mental health and well-being of seniors.
* Flexible hours to accommodate your academic schedule.

title: Generative AI Intern
description:
Presto (Nasdaq: PRST) is a public company that provides enterprise-grade AI and automation solutions to the restaurant industry. Presto was one of the relatively few technology companies able to successfully become public in 2022. Founded out of MIT in 2008, the company has grown to become the leader in drive-thru voice automation. Presto’s solutions are designed to decrease labor costs, improve staff productivity, increase revenue, and enhance the guest experience. Presto offers its AI solution, Presto Voice™, to quick service restaurants (QSR) and has some of the most recognized restaurant names in the United States as its customers.
 















 We are seeking a passionate and talented Generative AI Intern to join our dynamic team. This
 











 6-month
 











 internship offers the opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI technologies and contribute to the development of innovative solutions that enhance the restaurant drive-thru experience. As a Generative AI Intern, you will collaborate with experienced AI professionals and gain hands-on experience in designing, developing, and deploying generative AI models and evaluating prompt efficiencies in production systems.
   

  













 Responsibilities
 








* Assist in the research and development of generative AI models for various applications within the restaurant industry.
* Collaborate with the AI team to design, implement, and test algorithms and models that improve voice automation solutions.
* Analyze large datasets to train and fine-tune AI models, ensuring high accuracy and performance.
* Fine-tune AI model performance using state-of-the-art prompt tuning technique.
* Contribute to the development of AI-driven features and functionalities for Presto Voice™.
* Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and code reviews.
* Document research findings, methodologies, and code to support knowledge sharing and future development.
* Stay updated with the latest advancements in generative AI and related technologies.









 Qualifications
 








* Recent graduates with a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of machine learning principles, algorithms, and techniques.
* Experience with programming languages such as Python and frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts effectively.
* Problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude toward learning and development.
* Prior experience with prompt engineering.










 Presto (NASDAQ: PRST) has a compensation strategy that aims to reward high performers and retain them for the long term. Other benefits to U.S.-based employees include medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) program, and paid-time-off (PTO). To learn more, please visit: www.presto.com.
 

















 We value people from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive hiring process and work environment. We especially encourage historically underrepresented candidates to apply. title: Intern, Residential Asset Management
description:
**Applicant Deadline: Friday, September 13, 2024, at 11:59 pm EST.** 

**To apply, please include your resume and transcripts (full unofficial version).**

**OPPORTUNITY**

The Intern, Residential Asset Management will work in a highly collaborative team environment and will have responsibilities in the core areas of reporting, analysis, and research. The primary focus will be supporting the performance of Fengate’s growing multi-residential portfolio.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Analysis**

* Analysis support for internal and external stakeholders, including asset and portfolio performance analysis, financial analysis, market analysis and overviews, and the forming of recommendations.
* Provide support during due diligence processes with respect to assets for sale, as well as existing and potential development projects.
* Liaise with the other team to build and maintain cash flow and Argus valuation models for various purposes, such as setting budgets, analysis of lease transactions and development activities and their impact on value, impact of capital expenditures, etc.
* Create/analyze operational and financial reports by reviewing and analyzing variance on operational results, collections/arrears reports, capital expenditures, utility consumption, value add initiatives, valuations, asset plans, and market reports.

**Reporting**

* Assist with monthly and other periodic reporting of financial/operational metrics and presentations for both internal management and investor clients.
* Assist with other team reporting objectives including the review of semi-annual reforecasts and annual budgets, client pitches and presentations.
* Prepare, review, and analyze property and portfolio returns for periodic reporting purposes as well as ad hoc analysis.
* Assist with environmental, social and governance (ESG) programs and reporting.
* Create standardized slide decks and presentations that generate high-impact results based on industry standard key success factors such as profitability, occupancy and recovery rates, above/below market rate comparisons, etc.

**Research**

* Collect, organize, and strategically distribute diverse real estate information and data from a variety of sources including real estate industry websites, news articles, conversations with advisors, and research databases.
* Research residential properties and collect market information on lease and sale transactions, inputting and organizing data, researching online sources, and assist with corporate financial analysis and development.
* Develop in-house research databases and practices to assist in prioritizing target markets and submarkets for potential real estate investments.
* Conduct research on special topics in support of the team’s strategic initiatives and the wider organization’s goals and objectives.

**Requirements**

**KEY QUALIFICATIONS**

* A strong interest in real estate and asset management
* Pursuing an undergraduate business degree in real estate, finance, economics, or a related field.
* Experience with valuation techniques and cash flow modelling process is an asset – DCF, NPV, NER, Argus Enterprise.
* Prior residential real estate research and analytical experience is an asset but not required.
* Strong research and analytical skills including the ability to gather, interpret and effectively communicate macroeconomic, capital market and property market data.
* Critical thinking skills that can convert data into meaningful relationships and information to drive quality decision making.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including ability to articulate recommendations in a concise and timely manner.
* Task and goal oriented and capable of functioning in an entrepreneurial and corporate setting.

title: Learning and Development Intern (8 month contract)
description:
Company Description  
  
CAWST is a Canadian charity and licensed engineering firm. We address the global need for safe drinking water and sanitation by building local knowledge and skills on household solutions people can implement themselves.

At the heart of everything we do is our belief that when people have their basic water and sanitation needs met, they have the opportunity to succeed. This is what drives our dedicated team to work with a global network of more than 1,500 clients and partners. Together, we have reached over 34 million people since our inception in 2001.

Collectively, we are making a difference at a scale beyond what any of us could do individually. But our job isn’t done yet and we need you to help us expand our reach.

Job Description  
  
Do you dream of your work making a difference in the world? CAWST is an international development organization focusing on Sustainable Development Goal 6 - water and sanitation for all - and we’re looking for an organized, reliable, and passionate self-starter to support our learning and development team.

Join CAWST in a dynamic role where your passion and creativity drive the design, delivery, and evaluation of online, blended, and face-to-face learning materials. As a vital team member, you’ll actively develop, adapt and curate compelling capacity development resources. This position offers a diverse scope, allowing you to explore water, sanitation, hygiene, behaviour change, and instructional design subjects.

At CAWST, we need learning assets to be documented and easily and quickly accessible by our staff and clients. That means creating conditions for knowledge to flow between people and tools, identifying and capturing important information, and creating systems everyone can use with minimal time and effort to access and share.

* **Location:** CAWST is based in Calgary, AB. This position requires you to be located in Calgary.
* **Position Type:** Full-time, Fixed-term Contract (8 months)
* **Compensation:** Hourly, CAD 20.00 per hour (40 hours per week)
* **Start Date:** September 3, 2024
* **End Date:** April 30, 2025
* Applicants must be available to work from our Calgary office for at least four days per week (Monday to Thursday), with the flexibility to work from home on Fridays. Some evening or weekend hours may be required for events in Calgary.
* Our office is conveniently located close to public transportation.

**Responsibilities**

**Instructional design:**

* Support the planning, design, and execution of multiple projects concurrently.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts to assess learner needs, establish learning objectives, curate content, and craft training strategies and materials that spark behaviour change.
* Execute all phases of documentation processes, including planning, research, writing, reviewing, editing and publishing across various formats.
* Develop diverse learning aids, such as presentations, graphics, diagrams, videos and interactive e-learning.
* Explore and propose innovative learning tools and technologies for cutting-edge design solutions.
* Use TalentLMS, Articulate, communications platforms (such as WhatsApp), and other technologies and approaches to develop and manage engaging resources accessible to diverse internet connectivity levels.
* Adapt and tailor products to the cultural and educational contexts of a broad range of adult learners.
* Explore and experiment with leveraging AI tools in our work.
* Manage the instructional design of new resources and update and adapt existing resources.
* Create and set up automated communications that support our clients' learning journeys.
* Provide support for institutional analytics and reporting by tracking new and updated resources, online courses, registration and completion rates, and evaluations.

**Asset management:**

* Organize, track and troubleshoot the catalogue of online resources (washresources.cawst.org), including identifying and incorporating missing translations, repairing broken hyperlinks and establishing version control.
* Capture and catalogue metadata.
* Support in the organization and storage of design files and documentation.
* Leverage digital tools to enhance content management.
* Support the organization and maintenance of event creation and registration.
* Other tasks as required to support the management of learning assets.

We are looking for someone who is ready to dive in, learn, and get things done! We won’t ask you to be an expert in all of the above, but we will expect you to be curious and proactive, ask questions, seek clarification, and apply critical thinking to solve problems.

Qualifications  
  
**Education and Qualifications**

* This position is open to all education levels and areas of study. Preference may be given to those with specialization or experience in instructional design, knowledge management, or education.
* Ability to conduct self-directed learning on learning management, digital asset management and design technology is key to success.
* Experience with the following tools is an asset:
+ Talent LMS
+ Articulate 360 (Rise and Storyline)
+ Canto
+ Canva
+ Microsoft D365

* French or Spanish fluency is an asset but not required.

**Qualities we are looking for**

* Passionate and committed to CAWST and our cause
* Relentless researcher, able to find and clearly communicate information, formulate options and recommendations
* Organized and motivated professional, driven to achieve goals, with superior time management and organizational skills
* Accountable team player, you take your commitments seriously and keep your team informed
* Detail-oriented, you take pride in making sure nothing gets missed
* Self-starter with demonstrated ability to take initiative and seek consultation

  
  
Additional Information  
  
**Benefits of working at CAWST:**

* A meaningful role, making a difference every day for people living without basic water and sanitation
* A workplace culture where collaboration and innovation are fostered
* Rich on-the-job experiences and professional development opportunities
* Strong promotion of work-life balance and flexible work environment

**When applying, please include:**

* 
**A cover letter** that gives an overview of your experience as it applies to this role, and explains why you are excited about joining our team

* 
**Your resume**


*CAWST values equitable opportunities, sustainable solutions, and collaborative and inclusive processes. CAWST recognizes and accepts differences in cultural, religious, and political processes and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.*

title: Geotechnical Intern

**Description**

**Your Role at GEI.**

GEI Consultants is seeking a highly motivated geotechnical intern that will support the geotechnical and materials testing and inspection teams in various aspects (field work, lab work, reporting, etc.) during their summer co-op term. The successful candidate will gain exposure to and mentorship from leading technical experts in geotechnical engineering and materials testing and inspection works.

Positions are available for GEI’s Barrie, Markham or Guelph offices. In your application, please indicate which office(s) you would be available to work in. The selected individual may be required to be available to travel to the office daily throughout the co-op term.

**Essential Responsibilities & Duties**

* Conduct field work to support materials testing and inspection projects, including compaction testing, concrete sampling/testing, subgrade reviews, etc.
* Perform geotechnical engineering tasks such as drill rig supervision, surveying, soil and groundwater sampling, well monitoring and in-situ testing.
* Prepare detailed notes and take photographs to document the procedures used and observations made during field work and/or construction monitoring.
* Perform laboratory testing such as moisture contents, sieves, hydrometers, Atterbergs, proctors, etc.
* Aid in preparation of technical reports, memos, analysis and specifications.
* Adhere to Site Specific Health and Safety Plans prepared for each project site and participate in site safety briefings and audits.
* Coordinate scheduling with contractors and subcontractors.
* Coordinate with internal team members daily.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Pursuit of undergraduate degree in geotechnical/civil engineering or related field.
* Able to work in a team and independently.
* Exhibit a strong work ethic and high degree of motivation.
* Strong written and verbal communication, organization, and time management skills.
* Proficient with MS Office 365 (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and other computer applications.
* Access to a reliable means of transportation to the office and to job sites generally within 3 hours of the GTA.

**We are GEI.**

Some of the world’s most pressing problems – from climate change to sustainable development, to critical infrastructure and the future of our energy supply – need our brightest and diverse minds working together to create safer, more resilient communities for tomorrow.

With nearly 60 offices across North America, we offer a range of engineering, science, and technical consulting services. Our range of expertise, project types, and culture make us the choice for top talent in the AEC industry.

In 2023, GEI merged with GM BluePlan, an Ontario-based engineering, management, and technology consulting company. The merger adds GM BluePlan’s nationally recognized expertise in asset management and infrastructure planning to the GEI family, furthering our growth and expansion in Canada.

As a 100% employee-owned company, our employees support our flat leadership structure, have a say in how our business operates and benefit from our financial success. We are committed to employee growth with career development opportunities, competitive total rewards, a well-being program, flexible work arrangements and more. Our company culture is driven by our 4 Cs – we are Client-Centered, Curious, Collaborative, and Community Minded – which support our focus on sustainability, safety, diversity, equity and inclusion. Get to know us better by visiting GEI’s career site here.

**GEI’s Total Rewards Package**

* Market-Competitive Compensation
* Hybrid Work Schedules and Cell Phone Stipend
* Rewards and Recognition
* A Vibrant Culture that is Focused on Partnership, Sustainability, Giving Back to Our Communities and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
* And More…
